greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Dirichlet inverse of A126760.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..20000
mathematica: a[n_] := a[n] = If[n == 1, 1, -Sum[b[n/d] a[d], {d, Most@ Divisors[n]}]];
program: DirInverseCorrect(v) = { my(u=vector(#v)); u[1] = (1/v[1]); for(n=2, #v, u[n] = (-u[1])*sumdiv(n, d, if(d<n, v[n/d]*u[d], 0))); (u) }; \\ Compute the Dirichlet inverse of the sequence given in input vector v (correctly!)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 08 2019
